Reviews.Title: “2 nights in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Elaine H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this charming little hotel last week for 2 nights. Our room was on the main floor and as is the custom in Europe the room was very small and did not provide adequate space for 2 large suitcases. But it looked as though it had been recently renovated and it was very clean and comfortable. The Continental Breakfast buffet was very nice (just ask if you would like Cappuchino instead of regular coffee). The hotel itself was very close (5 minute walk) to the Train Station and Water Bus (Vaparetto). This was very convenient. I enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: lorisz
Reviews.Content: Charming, elegant hotel just a few minutes' walk from the train station. Got the room in the attic, which was rather small for the price but big enough; the price was about right for high season in Venice. Breakfast was forgettable (and espresso terrible) but I never rate hotels on their breakfast since in Italy a much better continental breakfast can usually be found just outside the hotel doors. In this case, it's true: Just across the strada there is one of the best pasticerrie in Venice, where they make the cornetti (croissants) fresh and the espresso is delicious. The hotel service was excellent, room was clean, shower/bath was good and the overall impression I got was positive. Good a/c. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad overall”
Reviews.Author: Gus213
Reviews.Content: A nice little hotel overall. In a good location, right next to the first bridge after the train station, not close to St Marks by any chance but ferrovia is still one of the busiest parts of the city. Rooms were clean and rustic looking, nice touch. However, one of 3 mornings that i was there, i was woken up by maintenance work happening outside my window (air compressor, concrete breaker, etc, the whole lot!!). Also although a double bed was requested, there was just two singles joined together, creating that familiar gap in the middle. However, i cant say that my stay was a disaster. The hotel was pleasant overall though, and particularly the staff; and i suppose one shouldnt ask for much more when he is not about to pay a pretty penny to get a 5 star in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Belle Epoque Venice”
Reviews.Author: Monadnock51
Reviews.Content: Wanted a room for one night in Venice. Arrived by train, so we wanted it to be within walking distance. Found Belle Epoque on line and booked it. It exceeded our expectations on every level. After being greeted warmly at the front desk, we were thrilled with our room. Very unique and so Venice. We asked for advice about how to spend the rest of our day and they couldn't have been more helpful. Located on a very charming street with shops and restaurants right outside the front door. After our full day of sightseeing came back to the hotel and asked for dinner suggestions. They suggested a wonderful and memorable restaurant within walking distance. Included breakfast which was amazing. Good value, wonderful ambiance. Highly recommend this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but lacks customer service”
Reviews.Author: debah
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Italy with my husband and 6 friends. As we got off the water taxi after experiencing an awesome ride into Venice from Marco Polo airport we were pumped, excited and overly happy! When we arrived to check in we were greeted by someone (can't recall the name) who was not so thrilled to see us. Check in was easy for most of us since we printed our confirmation email but one couple had forgotten to bring their confirmation number and apparently there is no way to check in without that information. After many minutes trying to find the confirmation email our friends were able to check in. The facilities were nice and comfortable. The breakfast was good as well, but was surprised of the lack of cheese selection and no hard boiled eggs (that I could find). The location was smack dab in the middle of the busy area of town. When I return to Venice, I will consider staying somewhere where the service may be better and the location is not in the middle of some major foot traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Like in museum”
Reviews.Author: Neli G
Reviews.Content: This was wonderful hotel. The room was very nice, breakfast was too big :) Great location, clean hotel, quiet room. Nice elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Trotamundos09
Reviews.Content: I stayed here about a year ago having found a very good rate online (right before high season, I guess). I had a single room right near the elevator. I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the room's furnishings given what I paid (other posters' photos are accurate). Yes, walls are thin, and you can often hear your neighbors. Bathroom was modern and looked recently renovated in my room. Most unusual part were the toilet and bidet that folded up when not in use! Breakfast was ample and included in my rate, and the breakfast room was very ornate (over the top according to other posters). Location was very convenient to the train station (less than 2-3 minutes walk), and was right next door to Brek, an Italian self-service dining chain that is a good option in over-priced Venice. Given the right rate, I would go back in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Ariella8
Reviews.Content: Overall a good experience. The location is perfect, near the train station and Piazzale Roma. The room was very big, clean and comfortable, average service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: rodsd
Reviews.Content: Hotel Belle Epoque was really a finding because it is a nice hotel located a few meters from Santa Lucia Train Station, and we booked it with a very good rate since it was winter time. Room was small but charming, decorated with taste, clean and with a very good shower; however we couldn't control the temperature of heating. Breakfast was good too. Reception people were professional but they could have been more warm though. I was really disappointed by the fact they did not provide me a city map (they had only a paid version).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adriana27v
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe how nice the room was. Like its name, the room was romantic and the decorations were amazing. The room we stayed in was small and quiet, at the last floor. The breakfast was really good with real cappuccino.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Nice Room, Near Railway Station, Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jackykk
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for one night. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It is located within walking distance to the train station. Many tourists shops around. Quite noisy if you don't like busy place. Very good quality breakfast. So I recommend paying extra to the room rate for the breakfast;

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, very close to train station”
Reviews.Author: eseliv
Reviews.Content: The best thing about hotel that is very close to train station. It's especially important becasue there is no any ground transportaion in Venice, you can use water taxi or bus (vaporetto) but it way more convenient to walk less than 5 minutes to the hotel. The hotel itself is quite nice it has its style, lots of antiquie style mirrors. Rooms are not very big, but clean and decorated in the same style as hotel. Free breakfast was good, Wi-Fi was not available in the rooms but I think it was working in the lobby but for a fee. To me staff was not exceptionally freindly, but polite and professional. We were surprised that Venice tourist map were not free in the hotel, but after a day in Venice we could fin any free or cheaper maps. Not a big deal, it's a few euros, but this is first time I saw that maps are not free in a hotel. So my only complain about hotel is no free Wi-Fi in the room, but I would probably stay they again because of location. We saw quite a few people trying to naviagte narrow and sometimes paved with cobbles streets of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: AnnArborMHT
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just one night and choose this hotel because of itâ€™s location near the train station and the main vaporetto docks. Reception was straightforward, with documents and payment, informative but not particularly friendly as noted by most reviewers. We were given the key to room 101, at 1:35pm, and found it unmade, beds stripped and bathroom dirty. Returned to reception, wondering why they would give us a dirty room and was told it would be cleaned by 2pm when the official â€œcheck in timeâ€� was, and not before! Requested another room, but was told there were no rooms with two single beds available; offered a room with one double bed. Looked at it and decided to wait. Returned to the hotel at 2:05 and the room was ready. For women traveling alone I would not recommend rooms on the ground floor 101-103 as the windows open up into a small inside courtyard with easy access to the windows and the glass elevator is located just outside the room window. While within the hotel complex, it still didnâ€™t feel safe and we couldnâ€™t leave the window open to cool down the hot room. The room was nicely decorated and appeared clean, until we pulled the beds apart and found dust balls everywhere. Poor soundproofing was a problem; in the next room there was a family with a baby that cried intermittently throughout the night and made sleeping difficult. TV had CNN in English and other assorted channels in different languages. The bathroom was clean, with only very minor mold noted in the shower area. The hairdryer was taped together at the base; prompting us not to use it. Breakfast was a pleasant surprise, as in Venice I am use to the basket of rolls and coffee only. The breakfast buffet had an assortment of rolls, pound cakes, meat, cheese, hardboiled eggs, tomatoes, breads with salad/meat toppings and peas! Yogurt, cereal and two types of juice were also offered, with coffee. Check out was at 11 and we were not departing Venice until 2 so we asked to leave our bags. The â€œbaggage storage areaâ€� is an unsecured, dark area under the stairs in the back of the hotel, where anyone could access your luggage without being noticed. I would suggest bringing a small lock it you plan to leave luggage here. We returned to pick up our luggage and use the hotelâ€™s public bathrooms near the elevator on the ground floor and was amazed that management appears to have removed the sinkâ€™s water handle (it was there in the morning) on the fish bowl sink, so you canâ€™t wash your hands/use the sink during the day! If they are trying to save money, this gesture just leaves a bad feeling when departing the hotel! Overall, my stay was OK but not a 3 star hotel and not worth 90EU/140 USD. I would look elsewhere before staying here again, but the location, near the train station is good.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: REBurwell
Reviews.Content: PROS: It was right near the train station, so easy to go and drop our bags off and then head out into Venice. It had air conditioning and the breakfast was quite nice. Rooms were a little dated but its been that way in every hotel that I've stayed at in Venice, adds to the experience of Venice!!! Also let us keep our bags there after we checked out in the morning, so we could explore Venice a little more before taking the train home. CONS: Staff was less than enthusiastic, but we did visit at the height of tourist season so they may have been sick of everyone by then!!! Overall: I'd stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but rude reception staff”
Reviews.Author: maple_syrup14
Reviews.Content: My daugter and I recently stayed here for two nights August 23-25,2011 - since this hotel was close to the train station and the reviews were good except for reviews regarding the reception staff, but I decided to give the hotel staff the benefit of the doubt. I totally agree with all the previous comments regarding the surliness of the check-in staff - the man who we were greeted by aka Hitler, never once made eye contact & ignored us completely for a few minutes while he completed what he was doing. He definitely made you feel like you were an inconvenience! We hoped that the other staff would be better the next day , unfortunately she was not much better (female Hitler), in fact they were so unapproacable that whatever information we needed about Venice we got from a nice jewellery shop vendor a few shops down the street from the hotel. Initially we tried to see if we could change their attitude by our greetings and smiles but too bad it did not work, so we totally ignored them when coming in or leaving the hotel. I do hope the hotel coaches them for their rudness. I would definately recommend this hotel if it were not for the staff. The rooms were good size and clean and the breakfast was really nice. In fact i woul have rated this hotel as excellent were it not for their reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: PatrickShelly
Reviews.Content: My first review ever, ofcourse because of my worst stay ever. We picked this hotel because of its location obviously. The front desk staff was super rude...he looks like hitler too :). Our room smelled like mold and it was horrible. The AC did not work at all and when we called the front desk, nobody picked up the phone. I am so glad we just stayed a night. Smelly, Hot place and rude staff. Will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: tk72
Reviews.Content: The experience was a mixed bag. The best part about the hotel was the location. Less than a minutes walk from St.Lucia Train station and no bridges to cross. Also very close to the vaporette/water taxi station. The 2nd best part was a lady at the breakfast table who was unable to speak english, was quite helpful. Breakfast was just Ok though, nothing to write home about. The room was very small, just enough space for the double bed. We had left one of our bags at the left luggage at the airport and were glad that we did so seeing the size of the room. We felt the decor was fairly gaudy. The staff at the front desk were a mixed bag. Ranged from pleasant and helpful lady to a man who seemed so overburdened with work that he refused to even acknowledge a guest's presence and seemed reluctant to speak. However, I think I would stay there again considering the location.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: someone1Ljubljana
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel three times and was always satisfied. I particularly like the location as it's just a few hundred meters from the railway station down the main street leading to the centre of Venice. I tried other hotels at different locations in Venice, but I find it too annoying to carry the luggage around the city (lots os steps, always crowdy, VERY difficult to move around with luggage) and on the vaporetto, where you have to pay extra for luggage and it's always so crowdy it's a mission just to enter or leave it. As the train station area is the main arrival point for any kind of transport it's ideal for staying if you don't want the extra fuss. I don't think Venice has the best or worst hotel location as every part of the city is interesting. This hotel is in good condition with a nice lobby. The furnishing is typical venetian, with lots of mirrors, velvet, brocade and rich colours. The rooms vary, but I prefer the ones who look at the street (it can be noisy as it's the main street which is always filled with tourists) and I find it charming to look down and observe the lively atmosphere. They are clean enough and have a venetian feel to them. The breakfast is delicious and has lots of varity, which isn't always the point in Venice hotels. You want to eat good and enough in the morning as grabbing a pastry and a sandwich at a caffe can be quite expensive. The room prices can vary depending on the season and the weekend/non weekend, but you can get a GREAT deal on the net. Only the receptionists could be more enthusiastic; they just couldn't be bothered. But I will return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Andrewcary11
Reviews.Content: Convient location, nice friendly staff, decent size rooms, very nicely decorated, and good bathrooms. What more could you ask for. Especially recommended for first timers on Venice. Easy to find, and easy to go everyplace else from there. A few hundred yards from train station, and all water taxi and ferries

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel near the train station”
Reviews.Author: david-206
Reviews.Content: Just adequate hotel. Small room; minute bathroom with folding toilet & bidet ! - but they work okay Typically awful Italian buffet breakfast, instant coffee machine, cheap supermarket style ham, salami, cheese, hard-boiled egg, juice-drink, not real juice.... But the bed was good, the air-conditioning worked, the staff were helpful. If you want or need to to stay near the train station & if the price is right, then... well, it could be worse...

Reviews.Title: “Teeny tiny, but location is ok and breakfastroom looks nice”
Reviews.Author: seolram
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, the bathroom even smaller... never seen a folding toilet before in a hotel! The airco was working and very welcome, breakfast was for Italian standards extensive. The breakfast staff was friendly, cannot say the same thing for the staff at reception. The many 'don't s ' displayed on the hotelroom door weren't very welcoming either (forbidden to use curling-tongs and iron?!). But, as stated many times before, if you travel by train, the location is fine: near a vaporetto stop with ticketbooth and close to the trainstation.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: andrewrclay
Reviews.Content: We just left the hotel this morning, 3/29/11 and I wish we would have never found it. Don't be fooled by the decor in the lobby that another reviewer described as "like the ritz" (must have never stayed at the rtiz). The lobby is nice and does give the misleading impression of a very nice hotel. Upon entering the room we were overcome by intense heat as the heater in the room and the bathroom were both on. We easily turned off the bathroom heat but there was no way to turn the room heat off. The first nights sleep was alright although we were both bitten by something. The second night when we returned to the room the heat was even stronger and there were mosquitoes all over the room. When we turned down the sheets we discovered small spots of blood on the sheets, when we called the front desk to ask for a new sheet we were told he could not give it to us until the next morning! We tried to sleep but in the stifling heat and with the mosquitoes buzzing by my head it was impossible. I went to the front desk at about 2am trying to get a different room but was told there was nothing available, the guy at the desk did turn the heat down though. Sleep last night was mediocre at best. Breakfast this morning was so so, the usual offering of meats and cheeses, bread coffee and juice. I stayed at a 1 star hostel two days ago in Florence that was nicer than this 3 star hotel. The only thing it has going for it is the location, less than a five minute walk from the train station. If you see this hotel, keep walking.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: travelling_duo5498
Reviews.Content: I booked Belle Epoque last minute. I read a lot of bad reviews about it, but given the short time before we get to Venice and the price range we are willing to spend, I gambled with Belle Epoque. Well, it was a game of chance I won! First of all, there was no better location. It was a few steps away from the train station, the vaporettos, and is surrounded by a lot of restaurants, gelateria, shops. Check-in was swift. The room was spacious (enough to fit 2 big suitcases and a trolley)nice and clean, with a large closet. The bathroom was spotless and well-heated. The breakfast was ample. They have space where luggages can be left in cases of late departures. Everything was contrary to the reviews I read before I booked it. Even the grouchy receptionist described in the reviews was nowhere. It was a pleasant experience. Or, could it be that lady luck was just with me? :)

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the worst hotels I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Janedollar
Reviews.Content: I would avoid this hotel. The only thing going for it was the location. The service was dreadful. The rooms were cold and we were bitten by something. The water barely warm. When we asked that something be done about it the man on reception was rude and unhelpful. The security in the hotel was very bad - frequently there was no one on reception and we had to collect our own keys. The breakfast was poor. We asked that we could leave a day early and they man at reception said we would be charged for it despite giving 3 days notice of our departure. Their terms say 72 hours notice. We asked to speak to the manager but he refused to see us. This was a truly unpleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: Hersheytravelers
Reviews.Content: We certainly didn't have any of the rooms pictured on the website. We had about 12 inches on either side of the bed. The bath was so cramped, that if you had tried to use the bidet, you would have broken your back, because the vanity extended over it. The air conditioner dripped all night and soaked the floor. There was no English station on the TV. We asked for another blanket, and the front desk said we couldn't get one until the next day. The lady in the next room had her jewelry stolen. Apparently, the bar in the lobby is just for show. Someone in our group asked for ice, and was told that the bar was not open, and that it never was going to open. We couldn't wait to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and well worth the price”
Reviews.Author: ggsjillydad
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Venice and we were very happy with the Belle Epoque First it is located very close to the train station but far enough away to not be a worry . We were able to get off the train and check in within 5 minutes which if you havent been to Venice is a plus. We saw hundreds of people pulling their luggage all over Venice no fun. The hotel is definitely Three stars the room was clean and large enough, also plenty of choices for breakfast each morning. If you are looking for a canal view this is not your hotel. The young lady at the front was a breath of fresh air everytime we saw her. You will have a 20 walk to San Marco or you can jump on the vaporetto and get there very quickly

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for site seeing”
Reviews.Author: TravellerThilak
Reviews.Content: Location is the primary advantage of this hotel, plus the interiors of hotel, including rooms. Amazing interiors, but the size of rooms could have been a bit large. Overall decent, value for money and satisfied our purpose of visit and stay. Just 5 min walk from S Lucia station is the Plus.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: avstralijka
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel on the basis of location and not having terrible reviews. When I got there, I was definitely pleasantly surprised. The downside for me was the staff who seemed rather unapproachable but I'd say that is the only downside of my experience while there. The room is tiny so big suitcases will probably be a little hard to manage. But the decor of it was lovely (the wallpaper, lamps) and really made you feel like you have arrived in Venice. It was clean and had no issues with mould in room or bathroom. There are a fair number of stairs that you might need to navigate so just keep that in mind Breakfast if fairly simple (hams, cheeses, breads, some pastries) but it gets the job done. The location is easy to find (as you always can head towards the station) and everything is a stone throw away

Reviews.Title: “fantastic just like the ritz!”
Reviews.Author: firsties
Reviews.Content: We stayed just on a B & B basis. Great location right by the station, very easy to find, decorated like the ritz. Lovely friendly staff, great room, fantastic breakfast good value for money, even though we thought venice was disappointing with the amount of graffiti and boats swerving to miss each other we couldn't fault the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful place stay away”
Reviews.Author: RichardWalesUK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Italy with friends and stayed at the hotel for two nights. The hotel looks really impressive when you arrive but the rooms (we had three between us) are dreadful. The decor is initially impressive but when we went into our room there was an over-powering smell of artifcial air-freshener which almost knocked us out. We found it on top of the wardrobe and put it outside the bathroom window so we could breathe! We later realised that the air-freshener was there to cover up the smell of damp which was just as unbearable. The walls are covered in fabric...and in our case MOULD all along the bottom half of the walls. The sheets and bed felt damp, and we dreaded having to get into it. The window had a view out onto a small yard which was adumping ground for rubbish...old shower doors and junk, totally depressing. The breakfast room is tiny and a bit of a squash. The staff are grumpy. We were only there for two nights (thank god) so didn't want to waste time and didn't want to make a fuss especially as we were with friends and their room stank also so we assumed all the other rooms would be the same. We were in rooms 103,102 and 105. When we checked out we told the girl on the desk who said she'd have a word with the maid! Dreadful...stay away...you have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel in venice”
Reviews.Author: Halvardt
Reviews.Content: venice is Ok, but finding a OK hotel til resonable price is a lottery. But this hotel was Ok for the price. Clean, Ok help. Small room but functional, and quite. But still Venice. Close to the railway. And we will as a family recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality for money paid”
Reviews.Author: Akas81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel, which takes you back to the '800, one night over the weekend. Excellent location right next to train station and boat stop. The lobby is absolutely elegant. Venetian glass chandeliers everywhere, walls covered with silk, antique-style furniture. Our room was very nice, the only drawback it had was two mattresses instead of one on the matrimonial bed. That was pretty disturbing at night. The bathroom was not big but functional, but that's what you would expect from hotels of this kind. Buffet breakfast was solid - great pastries, meats and cheeses, cereals, fruit and juices, boiled eggs, small sandwiches. The staff at the reception desk was exceptionally friendly. Definitely a place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near railway station. Definitely worth the money paid.”
Reviews.Author: jaskkk
Reviews.Content: We stayed there right before New Year's Eve 2009. I chose it because of convenient location from railway station and the price - 70 EUR/night incl. breakfast (double room). This hotel was definitely worth the money paid. Staff was friendly, no complaints. Though breakfast (except coffee) was not good.

Reviews.Title: “What a terrible place - do not go there!”
Reviews.Author: Denglish2010
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late, but I thought it needed to be available to others who may be considering staying at this awful place! I travel a lot and have stayed at many different types of hotels, some good, some bad, and some in-between. But this hotel was off the range. As I went into my tiny room (with a fold up toilet!), I thought it smelt weird, but I thought, "it's an old hotel, and I should expect it to smell musty".... but the smell got worse and my nose started itching.. then I noticed that the carpet was soaking wet. No idea where the leak came from, but it must have been there for a while for that smell to be so pungent. Anyway, I went down to the reception and asked to change the room. They didn't of course have any other rooms, and their basic reaction was that I could take it or leave it. As it was 10.00 pm by that time, I decided to stay, but agreed with the receptionist that I would get a discount of EUR 100 (room cost of EUR 150). The receptionist was quite helpful in that she put some towels down on the floor to soak up some of the liquid (I dread to think what it was!). I had the worst night ever (and I normally sleep like a puppy). Next morning, as I was checking out, they charged me EUR 100 and maintained that the receptionist from the night before had agreed this - I couldn't prove or disprove anything, so I paid - strangely enough, they charged the room on my colleague's credit card - maybe they were worried I would stop the payment. The staff were particularly unfriendly and actually seemed really fed up - they said I could phone the Manager if I wanted, but he wouldn't do anything. The hotel sells itself on its location (and the entrance/ reception area is grand) and they can really get away with anything. And they really don't care - it's not very often I come across people/hotels that really don't care.... and it really annoys me!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely NOT recommended for families - unless it's your last choice!”
Reviews.Author: exaustron
Reviews.Content: Hotel Belle Epoque - Venice 1/10 A mozzie ridden pit of a hotel, which is no longer "Belle" whose "Epoque" has well and truly passed. It has paper thin walls, constant sound of running water, a useless/broken shower which I had to fix, a duty manager who said she had no other rooms available to move us to, then 1 hour later when I was sitiing in reception took a walk in off the street. Her explanantion, "I've just had a cancellation", no beds - just a sofa bed for the kids. Do not stay in this hotel unless you have NO OTHER choices. If it was not in Venice and occupied by older American tourists (who all seemed very nice people), it would not be able to survive. It's one saving grace is proximity to the railway, we are not difficult to please (giving our hotels in Sorrento and Rome 9/10) but this is really not the place to stay as a family unless as a last resort. Sorry but all true!

Reviews.Title: “a good 3*”
Reviews.Author: eeuni
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is excellent, 7mins from bus loop station. Service in the hotel is average, the man was friendly but the lady was not. Walking distance to major sites, island is small so doable walking or boat taxis (which is right outside the hotel). Great pizza place just 3 doors down. Lobby is very clean and breakfast is good. Pastries are freshly baked the night before (we could smell in coming back in the prev evening). Rooms are spacious but we booked a 3 person room for 2 people b/c it was cheaper than other hotels in the city. This included a sofa bed that we just used to lounge instead. Bathroom was clean, towels fresh and white. One problem was the extra quilt in the closets, they looked like they were just folded and thrown in there. The closet was dirty so it wasn't nice to see and i didn't want to use the quilt as it looked quite unclean. There is a safe in the room and the keys were upgraded, room felt secure.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Belle Epoque helps to make your vacation perfect”
Reviews.Author: OksanaH
Reviews.Content: Service in the hotel is very good, everebody is friendly and helpful. Location is perfect: you can easely reach the place of your destination (even by walk, as Venice is not a big city in fact). Rooms are commodious, clean and include all the necessary furniture and things. Breakfast is included into a room price and consists of a quite good variety (only a coffee machine is fully automated: grind, pour and brew the coffee at the touch of a button, but me as an espresso-freak prefer traditional lever machines).

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Daleswife
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Belle Epoque as part of a tour - wild art deco type furnishings - very ornate and rich - Room was smallish as was bath - small shower stall but a bidet and stool - and heated towel racks. - no window - A/C did not work most of the time - one door opened to small courtyard- no windows at all so we had to leave door open - Breakfast was large and good - great pastries, meats and cheeses, cereals, fruit and juices, boiled eggs. Male clerk who also ran coffee machine was cold and surly - even at the front desk. Worst thing was we found out after second night we had bed bugs eating us alive - came home with red welts and itches - Location to taxis and train was excellent - good restaurants nearby -

Reviews.Title: “Location could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: AliceCapeTown
Reviews.Content: I chose this particular hotel because the blurb said it was 5 minutes walk from St Lucia Railway Station which it was. And what a pleasure that it was so easy to find. The hotel's frontage is deceiving and from the outside it looks quite small but inside it is a different story. We were greeted by a friendly receptionist (male) who welcomed us and directed us to our room which was cool (due to the air con - an absolute must in August!)and spacious. The hotel is situated on a busy street but because it is is set so far back, you don't hear a thing and we had one of the best night's sleep ever!! Breakfast the following morning was good, especially the fresh baked croissants and coffee. We returned a week later for another night's stay and were given a different room which wasn't quite as good in that the air con was not working initially and the shower was temperamental, but we had another great night's sleep so it couldn't have been that bad. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone, like us, who requires easy access to Saint Lucia railway station or even the Piazzale Roma (bus station). One tip - if going into Venice from Marco Polo airport, take the bus - at Euro 2,50 each way, it is a bargain - the water taxi costs around Euro 100!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller111Usa
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right next to train station. Grumpy french guy at night....but that was part of the charm.....

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: WeRFamily
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location--just a very short walk from the train station and vaporetto stops to all points in the city. That's a major plus for weary travelers not sure how to navigate Venice's transit system when they first arrive. The hotel is on a busy main drag, but the double-paned windows kept our room very quiet at night, even overlooking the street. The lobby is absolutely elegant. Our room was nice, if a bit dark (I don't love the Venetian style). Our young daughter slept in a sort of balcony space above the main room; it could get stuffy up there, but she loved it. The bathroom was small and a bit quirky but functional. Breakfast was a decent selection of breads, pastries, meat, cheese, etc. The woman who worked the reception desk was exceptionally friendly; the man, as others have noted, not so much. (I finally got him to crack a smile as we were leaving, when I complimented his ability to juggle many guests in at least four different languages.) Venice is overrun with tourists in the summer, and many service people betray a slight boredom or impatience with visitors--at least this gentleman was polite and professional, if not exactly welcoming. Although we were told it would cost 6 euros a day to use the internet, and that we could only connect downstairs in the lobby, we were able to pick up a free wi-fi signal in our room the whole time there. Overall, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near the train station”
Reviews.Author: Steinbrenner
Reviews.Content: Just a few meters from the train statin in Venice. The hotel was an easy walk for our family. The rooms were very clean and both bathrooms were new. Each room had a balcony, but it did not overlook the canel. The Hotel has a glass elevator that the kids loved. The hotel had a great breakfast. Italy is not know for their pastries, but there were great. The breakfast room is decorated in the typical Venice style. My family would be very hapy to return to this hotel. It is also an a wonderful shopping/restaurant street. Also very close to public transportation via boat and rail.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: blackfruitbat
Reviews.Content: Friends recommended this hotel, we didn't book but walked the 5 minutes to the hotel from the Santa Lucia Train Station on the island of Venice. They had vacancies for â‚¬100 a night. The room was ornately beautiful, everything was red and gold â€“ the wallpaper, carpets, curtains, bedspread, sofa. There was a lovely, compact bathroom along a short hallway. The location was brilliant, easy walk to the water taxi. The breakfast room was also beautifully decorated, good range of food and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to the train station”
Reviews.Author: letsg0travel
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a fantastic value. We stayed in May for 80 Euros a night. Very clean room, comfortable bed, quiet, A/C, helpful staff and pretty roomy for a Eurpean hotel. The hotel is just steps from the train station which is very handy if you are coming in with a lot of luggage. The free breakfast was wonderful - a lot of choices and tasted pretty good!

Reviews.Title: “Mold!”
Reviews.Author: SaMMorris
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice for a long weekend and when we walked into the hotel thought it was beautiful. Then we got to our room... We got the first floor room facing the street which we initially thought was a good room. Then we realized that we had to keep the windows open because they said they dont put the air conditioning on till may 15th. Also it smelled like mold in our room and the carpet on the floor felt wet when you walked on it, probably from the humidity. The landing from the room to bathroom was cracked in half- probably from mold, and the tiny bathroom smelled horribly like mildew. We couldnt keep the windows open at night because it was so loud because we were on the main street. Once you closed the windows the noise was no problem but it just smelled so bad and it was hot!! The housekeeping crew also did not make sure our door was locked when they left in the morning and we realized it was left open twice. The reception guy that was at night was also the biggest grouch ever!! He never said hello or goodbye or anything he didnt even smile, or even look at us in the eye. He just had this look on his face like he was better then everyone else and he was the most important person on earth. The location of the hotel was right around the corner from the train station which is what we wanted but their probably were a lot better hotels that we couldve stayed at. Dont wast youre time!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: jessybobs
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the Belle Epoque and loved it.. got a great deal for 60 euros a night for a double room, it was an attic room (mansarda) definitely one of the cheaper rooms in the hotel but still excellent value, there were no windows with views in the room just a skylight, also one in the bathroom which could not be opened. The room was a good size with all the usual facilities, but the wood beams were a little low in some areas, so if you are tall you need to watch your head. Bathroom was spotless, the shower was a large cubicle, even had a ledge to sit, but again ceiling a little low for a tall person. Reception rooms were fantastic, very plush and ornate with chanderliers and ornate guilded furniture, some of the staff were a little indefferent to say the least, some of the male staff did not acknowledge you leaving or asking for the key. The young lady that was on in the evening was lovely, polite and pleasant. Breakfast room also very plush.. and a great breakfast, I was very satisfied In all this is the 5th hotel I've stayed at in Venice and by far the best ( Lido Russo Palace was excellent, but the location of the Belle Epoque pips it to the post) Very easy to get to around, 10 minites from Piazalle Roma and 5 mins from the station. Vaporetto stops 5 mins also I would certainly stay here again and recommend it for an excellent stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “good base camp, no frills”
Reviews.Author: TimInBako
Reviews.Content: This hotel (actually spelled Hotel Belle Epoche on its marquee) is right near the train station, close enough to walk in one minute with bags. The advantage of this is that you don't have to cross any canals to get to the hotel, or hire a porter to haul your bags. Very easy to settle down when you arrive, tired from traveling. The hotel is very old, like everything in Venice - that's why you go there. The room decor is a flambouyant Venetian style with striped wallpaper, chandeliers, etc. Like many places in Venice, there was a moldy smell when the windows were open - rather unpleasant. However, we were in Venice to exploe the art treasures and historic architecture, not hang around our hoel room. The staff were cordial and helpful. When we had a problem with a credit card transaction from a nearby restaurant, they gave us some accurate advice on how to work it out. Breakfast is included, and is pretty basic - coffee, rolls, cereal, fruit, yogurt. You will not starve if you get up by 10:00. Some rooms have elevator service - ours on 2nd foor did not. No biggy. There is a Vaporetto (water bus) stop right near the hotel. You can easily ge around the whole city from there. (Tip: Get an all-day pass and ride Vaporetto line 1 all the way from one end to the other to get a good overview of the whole city!) All in all, this was a very good value. The location was the biggest advantage.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat the location”
Reviews.Author: AntigenBand
Reviews.Content: Despite being a bit tacky, the hands down best part of this hotel is its location - it's literally 3 mins from the train station. In a city which is extremely luggage-unfriendly (think lots of bridges and narrow walkways), this is a very important point. Note the train station is not in the same building as the bus station. We paid 80 Euros a night, stayed twice on 2 separate occasions. Our first room was somewhat small, but the second was better. The AC was very important to have at night after a long day of sightseeing in the heat, especially in humid Venice. We did have issues controlling the AC temperature, so we ended up freezing most nights. The breakfast was quite good, though not out of this world. They had that nice creamy European yogurt which I love and can't seem to find in Canada. All in all, I think it was a good deal, considering typical hotel prices in Venice. The beds are very comfy, the room spotless (albeit tackily decorated, in my opinion, old Venetian style) . The staff was friendly, but had an air of haughtiness - this attitude was common throughout Venice, to be fair. Quick advice, don't bother taking a water taxi to town from the airport - save yourself about 90 euros and take the express bus for only 3 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Your typical Italian hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: ImFromMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Belle Epoque is probably similar to a thousand Italian hotels - some things very good, some not so good, most things average or satisfactory. Its best features are location (about one minute's walk from the train station and on a busy street full of shops and eateries) and the decor, which is amusingly garish. They are very proud of their glass elevator too, which is a recent addition and looks a little out of place - but it does the job. I enjoyed their breakfasts too, a typical Italian hotel breakfast but plenty of choice and the kitchen staff are friendly. The rooms at Belle Epoque are small-ish but comfortable enough; the marble bathrooms are functional and roomy enough. There's no view to speak of but you're probably not going to spend much time in the room anyway. It can be a bit hard to find at first: just head out of the train station, turn left, walk 100 metres and it's on your left. And the desk staff could use a few happy pills also.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryLove2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and had a wonderful stay. The rooms were extreamly comfortable and clean. The hotel is close to everything. About a 15 min walk to Rio Alto Bridge and about a 20 min walk to St. Mark's square. We would definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Grouchy Reception Personnel”
Reviews.Author: nancys
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, though a bit cheesy hotel, right next to the train station. The decor is very old style Venetian with a good breakfast. The only problem is that the Reception Clerk, Giovanni, was so unpleasant that he almost ruined our trip. My daughter and I called him "grumpy" the rest of the time. The other clerks were okay but not helpful with recommendations for restaurants or boat schedules. Would recommend but always recommend trying to book directly from the hotel to save booking fees from the travel websites. Paid only 80 euro which was a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience!”
Reviews.Author: aderub
Reviews.Content: We had our room changed (from a normal one to an extra small one) and our luggage moved to the new room without our permission when we were out for dinner and without any prior communication nor late excuses! We will never go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, God rates”
Reviews.Author: VeronicaG
Reviews.Content: My friend and I arrived in Venice early in the morning on the train from Lake Como. We arrived at the hotel early as well, and the polite front desk clerk advised that it was too early to check in. He was kind enough to hold our bags for us until we returned. We dropped off the bags, and set about to seeing Venice. We returned to the hotel around 215pm, and found that the staff had changed shifts. The afternoon guy, not so nice. He asked for my name to look for the reservation. I gave it to him...three times. He got frustrated too quickly and stated that he could not find my reservation. I even spelled it for him...THREE times. I finally got my passport out and showed him my last name, He then got very angry with me and proceeded to lecture me about the correct pronunciation of my last name!! He went on to tell me (in english) that he is not an English speaker so therefore I need to learn how to correctly pronunciate my name well enough for him to understand!! I was quite certain that SPELLING it three times would have worked!! He finally finished processing our checkin and we were on our way. The room was clean, comfortable, as was the bathroom. The best part was that our room #402 faced the back of the hotel, so it was REALLLLY quiet, which was nice. The hotel also had a lift/elevator for baggage. Breakfast was predictable but tasty with an assortment of pastries, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, fruit, thin ham slices, bread for toasting, and three varieties of juice. Overall, i would stay there again as the price was right and the location was great, I would just be sure to learn how to say my own name correctly.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: vacay1117
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. The staff were super-friendly, rooms were clean, and best of all it is located right near the train!! I would highly recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A little treasure”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Hoxtonite
Reviews.Content: I was anxious because this was the first time I'd booked with Expedia, but everything went like clockwork. Kiosk staff at the airport were excellent, explaining various ticket options for the bus to Venice. The Belle Epoque is close to the bus station - out of the bus station to the Grand Canal, turn right, cross the bridge, right again, and the hotel is just on the left - so you don't have to carry your luggage a long distance. Welcoming staff, a comfortable room in a well-situated hotel. What more could I ask for? The breakfast (served in the breakfast room) was good, but could become boring if on a longer stay. My room was on the second floor, accessed by stairs rather than a lift, but was comfortable and adequate for one person. The bathroom was small, but well-equipped. It could have been cleaned to a higher standard, though. The hotel is close to the waterbus stop connecting you to all parts of Venice, and is situated on the main thoroughfare leading through the city. An excellent location. Altogether a good experience for my first visit to Venice,and I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: WestOzgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and found the location to be fantastic. Only a few minutes walk from the train station, and on a main street filled with shops, restaurants, etc. Great budget restaurant very close by was BREK . On the downside, the 2 of the 3 reception staff were unfriendly and unhelpful. To reach my room, I had to take the lift, and then walk up a very narrow steep staircase of 10 steps, to some sort of tiny landing - very difficult with a heavy suitcase, which I had to push up the stairs one step at a time. As there was a timber railing above the stairs, it wasn't possible to stand upright and pull the case up the stairs. No help was forthcoming form any of the staff, and I really struggled with this. SOmeone old or a bit infirm would not manage this set of stairs every time they had to come or go. The room had long timber beams all the way across the ceiling, which were so low that I bumped my head on them several times. A tall person sitting up in bed would have bumped their head on the beams, which extended across the bed . Bathroom ceiling was also very low. Room would have been very claustrophobic for a tall person. Breakfast room was very pleasant compared to some of the hotels I stayed in in Italy. For 60 euros a night, I thought this was very good value, but when booking, specify you want a room which is not one of the 2 located on the stairs at the top of the landing on the 2nd floor!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Feistylion
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at this hotel for 100euro a night. Very easy to find, just a 2 min walk from Santa Lucia station. Lovely street with shops and restaurants right at your door. The room was lovely, decorated in typical venitian style with a very modern bathroom. Our room had a large balcony which was great. Very clean and had no problems. Reception staff were not particulary friendly or helpful but that would be the only negative thing I could say about this hotel. About a half hour stroll to San Marco which is a lovely walk. After researching an affordable hotel in Venice for ages I was very happy with this choice at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobic Room”
Reviews.Author: ginaTravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a very nice lobby and friendly staff. The price was reasonable, and it was clean and safe. The only complaint I have is that the room did not have a very cosy feel. I don't mind small rooms, but I didn't really look forward to going back to the hotel at night. My room was decorated with a weird crimson theme. The bathroom fan was really loud. I can't really expain the missing ingredient. I would probably look for another hotel next time, though I have nothing terribly bad to say about this one.
